citations.narrative:
In 1-2 of the outdoor runs, the fence material had been damaged creating sharp points that could injure the dogs. In
another 1-2 enclosures, the fence had been secured with metal pipe fittings that were left long and potentially could injure
the dogs housed inside. These enclosures must be kept in good repair and constructed and maintained to remove the
sharp points or edges to prevent injury to the dogs housed in the enclosures.
Corrected during inspection.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the Institutional Official.
Additional Inspectors:
William Campbell, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n

narrative:
3.6(a)(2)(ii) 
   
Primary enclosures. 
In 1-2 of the outdoor runs, the fence material had been damaged creating sharp points that could injure the dogs. In 
another 1-2 enclosures, the fence had been secured with metal pipe fittings that were left long and potentially could injure 
the dogs housed inside. These enclosures must be kept in good repair and constructed and maintained to remove the 
sharp points or edges to prevent injury to the dogs housed in the enclosures. 
 
Corrected during inspection. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the Institutional Official. 
 
Additional Inspectors: 
William Campbell, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n
